short_summary: Parks Canada is soliciting for Stage 1 - Administration Building Parking Lot - Yoho National Park.
description: The Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) is for a two-stage selection process. Bidding will be open to pre-qualified suppliers. Following the evaluation of all submissions, the Contracting Authority will provide a list of pre-qualified suppliers or invite the interested suppliers to the ITT stage. Bidders who successfully pass the ITQ stage will be invited by the Contracting Authority to submit an ITT for the project. A contract will be awarded once the ITT is received.

full_summary:
---

### Stage 1: Administration Building Parking Lot – Yoho National Park

**Government of Canada Tender Notice**

**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0108/A

**Publication Date:** 2023-06-22

**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-07-06T16:00:00

**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-07-27

**Expected Contract End Date:** 2023-11-01

Parks Canada is inviting qualified contractors to submit their response to a two-stage selection process for the construction of a new parking lot at the Yoho Administration Building in Field, British Columbia, Yoho National Park. 

**Request:**
The successful contractor will be required to demolish and excavate the existing playground and fencing, followed by the construction of a new asphalt parking area, cast-in-place concrete accessibility ramp and stairs, canopies, and associated electrical infrastructure.

**Estimated Value:**Between $250,001 and $500,000 (inclusive of taxes).

**Instructions to Bidders:**

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Please submit your bid via email to [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca) or via fax to 1-855-983-1808.  
* Documents must be attached to the email, and not provided via a link. 
* For attachments larger than 15MB, bidders must submit their bid in multiple emails labeled with the solicitation number, project name, and number of emails included. 
* Fax or in-person submissions will not be accepted.

**Important Notes:**
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language.
* The bidding process is governed by the following regulations: National Parks Regulations, National Park Act.

**Next Steps:**
The evaluation of Stage One submissions will proceed in accordance with the evaluation criteria outlined in the solicitation documents. After evaluation, successful bidders will be invited to submit a financial bid for the project.

Please find all relevant documents available through the Government of Canada's tendering service, at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact:
Jennifer Maheu
Email: [jennifer.maheu@
